Class Writer

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs.man.ac.uk.io.Writer

  • public class Writer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods used for writing to files.

    1.0, 05/01/13
    Author:
    Rob Lyon

        public Writer()

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public static boolean write(java.lang.String path,
                            java.lang.String text)
        Writes a string literal to a specified file. The literal is appended to the end of the file in question.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the file to which the string literal will be appended.
        text - the string text to append to the file.
        Returns:
        true if the write operation was successful, else false.

      • append

        public static boolean append(java.lang.String path,
                             java.lang.String text)
        Writes a string literal to a specified file. The literal is appended to the end of the file in question.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the file to which the string literal will be appended.
        text - the string text to append to the file.
        Returns:
        true if the write operation was successful, else false.

      • clear

        public static boolean clear(java.lang.String path)
        Clears a file of data.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the text file to clear.
        Returns:
        true if the file was cleared successfully.
